channel.title: Parent Previews: Movies Now In Theaters
channel.description: Parent oriented reviews for movies now playing in theaters.
channel.dc:creator: registration@parentpreviews.com

item.title: Way Back, The
item.description: After escaping from a concentration camp in Siberia during WWII, a small and desperate group of prisoners (some of whom are played by Jim Sturgess, Ed Harris Colin Farrell and Saoirse Ronan) walk over 4000 miles through unforgiving wilderness to try to find freedom and safety in India.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Way Back, The

item.title: Biutiful
item.description: Uxbal (Javier Bardem) has an unusual ability -- he can read the minds of the recently deceased. This talent leads to an equally unusual life for the desperate man who tries to make his living in the black market of Barcelona.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Biutiful

item.title: From Prada to Nada
item.description: Wealthy and pampered Mary and Nora Dominguez (Camilla Belle and Alexa Vega) become suddenly poor and dependant when their father unexpectedly dies, leaving the sisters in the care of an estranged aunt who lives in East Los Angeles.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: From Prada to Nada

item.title: Mechanic, The
item.description: Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is a professional assassin known as a mechanic. When the man (Donald Sutherland) who taught him the business is killed, Bishop agrees to help his mentor's son (Ben Foster) learn the trade so they can seek revenge together.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Mechanic, The

item.title: Rite, The
item.description: Although he is skeptical of the reality of demonic possession, an American seminary student (Colin O'Donoghue) attends several exorcisms performed by a believing priest (Anthony Hopkins).
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Rite, The

item.title: Company Men, The
item.description: Whether downsized, laid off or fired, losing a job is a hard thing to endure, especially for people like Bobby Walker (Ben Affleck), whose sense of identity is tied to his career. Following his plight for one year, this movie explores how unemployment affects him, his family, his community and his former co-workers.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Company Men, The

item.title: No Strings Attached
item.description: Adam Kurtzman (Ashton Kutcher) and Emma Franklin (Natalie Portman) each have busy lives with different aspirations, yet they both want sex. So the friends agree to a physical relationship with no stings attached -- but it isn't long before their emotions begin to get tangled up in the arrangement.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: No Strings Attached

item.title: London River
item.description: When Elizabeth (Brenda Blethyn) cannot contact her daughter after the 2005 London bombings, she heads into the city to try and find out what has happened to her adult child. During her search she keeps bumping into Ousmane (Sotigui Kouyaté), a Muslim man who is also looking for his missing son. Before long she begins to suspect there may be a reason why their paths keep crossing.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: London River

item.title: Dilemma, The
item.description: What would you do if you knew the wife (Winona Ryder) of your best friend (Kevin James) was having an affair? In this comedy, to tell or not to tell is the dilemma facing Ronny Valentine (Vince Vaughn).
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Dilemma, The

item.title: Green Hornet, The
item.description: Finding no purpose in his life as the inheritor of a prosperous newspaper empire, Britt Reid (Seth Rogen) is inspired to secretly reinvent himself by Kato (Jay Chou), his father's former mechanic. Together the pair creates a masked superhero known as The Green Hornet.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Green Hornet, The

item.title: Season of the Witch
item.description: In the hope of stopping the Black Plague from continuing to spread across his homeland, a returning Crusader (Nicolas Cage) and his companion (Ron Pearlman) accept a request from church officials to escort an accused witch (Clair Foy), suspected of causing the problem, to an isolated abbey.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Season of the Witch

item.title: Country Strong
item.description: Kelly Canter's (Gweneth Paltrow) career as a country singer is on the rocks, and even rehab doesn’t appear to be enough to save it. Nor do things improve when her husband/manager (Tim McGraw) tries to introduce some new talent (played by Garrett Hedlund and Leighton Meester) into the mix.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Country Strong

item.title: Blue Valentine
item.description: While there may have once been some real romance between Dean (Ryan Gosling) and Cindy (Michelle Williams), as the stresses of life wear away at their relationship, the future looks less and less rosy.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Blue Valentine

item.title: Illusionist, The (2010)
item.description: In this French animation, an aging magician (Jean-Claude Donda) finds his future becoming more uncertain as audiences lose interest in his act. Then he meets a young fan named Alice (Eilidh Rankin), who may bring new direction to his life.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Illusionist, The (2010)

item.title: Another Year
item.description: Tom and Gerri (Jim Broadbent and Ruth Sheen) have been happily married for a long time. Over the course of one particular year the couple finds plenty of opportunities to provide support to their friends and family, who all seem to be struggling to find joy and purpose in their lives.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Another Year

item.title: Gulliver’s Travels
item.description: In this modern retelling of the classic novel, Lemuel Gulliver (Jack Black) accepts an assignment to write a story about the Bermuda Triangle. But instead of a tropical trip and a chance to prove his journalistic chops, Gulliver finds himself trapped in a land full of little people who see him as a giant problem.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Gulliver’s Travels

item.title: Somewhere
item.description: Actor Johnny Marco (Stephen Dorff) seems to have everything: Fancy hotel room, sporty car and all the women he could want. Then his eleven-year-old daughter (Elle Fanning) shows up on his doorstep. Forced into taking care of the girl, Johnny must also decide if he is ready to take responsibility for his life.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Somewhere

item.title: King’s Speech, The
item.description: One of the biggest impediments to George VI (Colin Firth) performing his royal duties is a stammering problem, so the skills of a therapist named Lionel Logue (Geoffrey Rush) are sought to assist in improving The King's Speech.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: King’s Speech, The

item.title: True Grit
item.description: In this gritty gunslinger, fourteen-year-old Mattie Ross (Hailee Steinfeld) hires a trigger-happy U.S. Marshal named "Rooster" Cogburn (Jeff Bridges) to help her capture the man (Josh Brolin) who murdered her father. The spunky girl also insists on accompanying the oft-drunk, disreputable lawman. Later, their posse is joined by Texas Ranger LaBoeuf (Matt Damon), who has his own reasons for tracking Chaney.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: True Grit

item.title: Little Fockers
item.description: Even though Greg and Pam (Ben Stiller and Teri Polo) have now been married for ten years, and have two little Fockers, relations with the in-laws, especially with Grandpa Jack Byrnes (Robert De Niro) are still strained. Adding to the tension are a family gathering planned for the twins' birthday and Greg's moonlighting job selling male-targeted pharmaceuticals.
item.dc:subject: Movie Review: Little Fockers
